title: Unpin frozen columns on screen sizes below 768

custom_steps: WHEN user is on Widgets with frozen columns (ex. Roster Widget)
custom_expected:
THEN no columns should be frozen.
AND frozen column would be unpinned so user can horizontally scroll the entire table
AND the drop shadow associated with a frozen column should not appear.

title: As a user I want to see an Employee Contract reflected in the employee's History
custom_preconds:
GIVEN Club or BOC user logs in with UEC permission
AND An employee has an approved UEC
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to Employee's History
custom_expected:
THEN system should display the following information about the UEC: 
  * Date on the History corresponds with the Signing Date.
  * Code is "EE Cont"
  * Org/Club From is the Signing Org. 
  * Org/Club To is blank.
  * Description reads: "Signed Negotiated Employee Contract â€“ Position: <Position> Years: X Option Years: Z 1st Year: YYYY" where <Position> is replaced with the Position from the contract (ex: Coach), X is the guaranteed years and Z is option years. YYYY is replaced with the first year of the contract.
AND Clicking on the description opens the contract.

title: As a user I want to be able to search for Employee Contracts
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user logged in with Employee Contract permissions
AND the user has navigated to Advances Search
custom_steps: WHEN the users selects Employee Contracts for "Search For" field
custom_expected:
THEN The filters available when "Employee Contracts" has been selected will match the provided specs. 
AND Clicking search will search the database for any Employee Contracts that meet the applied filters.
AND After results are found, the results will display according to the requirements.
AND Users will be able to export these results to excel.
AND Users will be able to export these results to pdf. 
AND Users will be able to use the type to filter option
BUT If no results are found the table displays with "No records found"

title: As a user I want to save an employee contract with Club standard language in a clause
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to create Employee Contract
AND user is creating Employee Contract
AND user has selected a clause 
AND user has stored a language for the selected clause
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks the Language dropdown
custom_expected:
THEN If stored Club language is available for the selected clause, then it is displayed in the Language dropdown.
AND The user can select the stored language for use in the clause.
AND Selecting a stored language for use does not prompt the language to appear on the contract itself (on the front-end).
AND Clicking "Save" or updating the contract state should save the selected language so that when the contract is re-opened the language is still selected.

title: As a user I want to save an employee contract with BOC standard language in a clause
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to create Employee Contract
AND user is creating Employee Contract
AND user has selected a clause 
AND user has stored a language for the selected clause
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks the Language dropdown
custom_expected:
THEN If stored BOC/LRD language is available for the selected clause, then it is displayed in the Language dropdown. 
AND The user can select the stored language for use in the clause.
AND Selecting a stored language for use does not prompt the language to appear on the contract itself (front-end).  
AND Clicking "Save" or updating the contract state should save the selected language so that when the contract is re-opened the language is still selected.

See Wireframe:
http://30ac5x.axshare.com/#p=major_league_compensation

title: As a user I want to enter and save Complex language on a bonus clause
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to create Employee Contract
AND user is creating Employee Contract
AND user has selected a Bonus clause 
AND user wants to enter complex language in a Bonus clause
custom_steps: When the user selects "Complex" as the criteria for a bonus clause, salary escalator or conditional option
custom_expected:
Business Value:
Allows clubs and LRD to create their own criteria for awarding an incentive bonus, salary escalator or Option. 

THEN a WISYWIG editor will appear in the contract form.
AND Users will be able to use the WISYWIG editor to construct custom criteria for the bonus using basic formatting such as italics, bolding, underlining and bullet points.
AND Any formatting that will not be supported in printing should not be an option in the WISYWIG editor.
AND Users have requested that the WISYWIG editor used be compatible with copy/paste from MS Word.
AND WISYWIG editor needs to be able to accommodate Spanish language and special characters.
AND Maintain the text entered if "Complex" is selected, even if the user switches to another Criteria as long as they have NOT the contract between switching. 
AND Clicking "Save" or updating the contract state should save the entered language so that when the contract is re-opened "Complex" is still selected and the WISYWIG is populated with the entered text.

title: As a user I want to be able to delete an employee contract
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC logged in with permissions to delete an employee contract
AND a user is in edit or view mode for preliminary or reject signed employee contracts
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on delete button
custom_expected:
THEN Clicking delete should prompt the user to confirm the deletion.
**Title:** Warning
**Body:** Are you sure you want to delete this [form]? ("Form" to be replaced with Employee Contract)
**Hint:** This is a permanent action that cannot be undone.
**Buttons:** Yes, No
AND If they confirm the deletion, the contract should be removed from the system and no longer displayed on the player's Contract History or appear in search results. 
OR If they do not confirm the deletion, no action should be taken and they should be returned to the form. 
AND The user should be returned to the player's Contract History.

title: As a user I want to be able to print the Info section of an Employee Contract
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to print employee contract
AND an employee has an exiting employee contract
AND user has navigated to a contract in View mode or Edit Mode
custom_steps: WHEN user click "Print" button
custom_expected:
THEN the system will download a pdf of the printed Infor section UEC.
AND Information from the "Info" section of the contract screen is accurately reflected in the printed contract. 
AND The boilerplate contract should also be included in this story. 
AND The player's address prints as it is laid out in the Printing Rules above. 
AND Presentation and all language used should match ebis1.

title: As a user I want to be able to add a Threshold Table to an Incentive Bonus clause in a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to create Employee Contract
AND user is creating Employee Contract
AND user has created an Incentive Bonus clause 
AND user is in the incentive bonuses section of an employee contract
custom_steps: WHEN user click "Threshold Table" button available for each Incentive bonus clause.
custom_expected:
THEN system will add the table per the data discovery.
AND Threshold field in the clause will update to say "TABLE"
AND The user can Add multiple terms to the table using the "Add Term" button that is only available in edit mode.
AND The user can delete all but one of the terms using trash cans associated with each added term. 
AND The user can add a Pay Schedule for each term in the table. 
AND The user can delete the table by clicking on the "Delete Table" button that is only available in edit mode. 
AND The "Total Potential" at the base of the threshold table will update on "Save" of the contract and is straight addition of the entered amounts.

title: As a user I want to be able to add a Pay Schedule to a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club and BOC is logged in with the permission to create employee contract
AND the user is creating employee contract
AND the user wants to add a Payment schedule to the contract they are creating
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on the Pay SCH button
custom_expected:
THEN the system will launch a pop up where the user can view/edit the Pay Schedule
AND If the contract is in edit mode, then the Pay Schedule is in edit mode.
AND If the contract is in view mode, then the Pay Schedule is in view mode. 
AND In edit mode If no payments exist yet, the payment schedule should show a blank row by default (in edit mode only). 
AND If payments do exist, those should display. 
AND The user should see the buttons OK and Cancel. 
AND Clicking OK does NOT save these changes permanently. These changes are only stored in the database when the entire contract is Saved. 
AND Clicking Cancel will discard any changes made to the Payment Schedule, and no rules will fire. The payment schedule will close and no changes will be stored.

title: As a user I want to be able to move a UEC to Submit Signed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with UEC edit permissions
AND user is viewing a UEC in edit or view mode in Preliminary status
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Update Status" button
custom_expected:
THEN system will display the option to move the contract to "Submit Signed".
AND Selecting "Submit Signed" will perform a required field and formatting check, and if that passes then save the contract as it is currently entered.
AND The contract is assigned a status of "Submit Signed". 
AND The contract in the player's Contract History should appear in green. 
AND The contract should reload in View mode if it was previously in edit mode. 
AND A blue notification will display that states that the contract's status has been updated to Submit Signed.

custom_expected:

title: As a user I want an employee's Superceded contract to be moved back to Approved if the new contract is moved to Reject Signed

custom_steps: WHEN current contract is move to Reject Signed status
custom_expected:
THEN Superceded contract to be moved back to re-enacted as the 'active' 

Reject Signed Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/6.+Reject+Signed+-+State+Change+Rules

title: As a user I want any attachment with a label of Contract to be stamped on approval
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user created a Employee contract 
And Attached valid contract PDF
custom_steps: WHEN the Contract is moved from Update Status - > Approved
custom_expected:
THEN system will prompt the user to pick where to place the signature stamp. 
AND "Default" will be the default selection on the pop up. 
AND "Custom" will be the other option. Selecting "Custom" will display fields for the user to specify the page (counted back from the last page) and the x/y coordinates for the signature stamp. The fields will default to the default location as calculated by the system based on the current version of the saved contract. 
AND "None" will be another option. Selecting "None" will not stamp the contract at all when "Approve" is clicked. 
AND The buttons on the pop up will be "Approve" and "Cancel". 
AND Clicking "Cancel" will close the popup and cancel the state change. 
AND If "Custom" is selected, the "Approve" button will be disabled if any of the fields are left blank. Otherwise, clicking Approve will stamp the attached pdf with the signature stamp in the indicated location. 
AND If "Default" is selected, the "Approve" button is always enabled and the system will stamp the attached pdf on Approve in the default location. 
AND The date used is the date the UEC was Approved.

*Note that this matches the process used for MJ Contracts*

title: As a user I want to be able to resubmit a UEC
custom_preconds:
View-Edit-State Change Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/2.+UEC+-+View-Edit-State+Change+Rules
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Data+Discovery (must click into lower level documents)
Reject Signed Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/6.+Reject+Signed+-+State+Change+Rules
GIVEN a user is logged in as a Club or BOC user with Edit permissions for a UEC
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a UEC in Edit or View Mode in Preliminary
custom_expected:
THEN there should be an Update Status button
AND clicking the "Update Status" button should display the option to move the contract to "Submit Signed"
AND selecting "Submit Signed" should perform a required field and formatting check, and if that passes then save the contract as it is currently entered
AND the contract should be assigned a status of "Submit Signed"
AND the contract in the player's Contract History should appear in green
AND the contract should reload in View mode if it was previously in edit mode
AND a blue notification should display that states that the contract's status has been updated to Submit Signed
AND any "Rejection Reason" comments that were previously visible on the UEC should be removed
AND an Approvals item should be generated for the BOC
AND the Action Item for the UEC should be removed.
AND if the employee's current position does not match that contained in the UEC, then an Assign/Reassign Transaction should be auto-created and submitted by the system for the position contained on the UEC

title: As a user I want to be able to edit an existing UEC
custom_preconds:
View-Edit-State Change Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/2.+UEC+-+View-Edit-State+Change+Rules
On Save Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/10.++On+Save
**All of these steps assume proper edit permissions and that Club users belong to the Signing Org**
GIVEN a user is logged in with edit permissions for UEC
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to edit an existing UEC
custom_expected:
THEN Club users should be able to edit any portion of the UEC in Preliminary and Reject Signed states
AND Club users should only be able to edit the Authorized Signatory, Signing Date, and Attached Files in a Completed State
AND Club users should not see an edit button in the Submit Signed or Approved or higher states
AND BOC users should be able to edit any fields in all of the states
AND saving in any state other than Preliminary and Reject Signed should run all required field and formatting checks
AND saving the contract in any Approved or higher state should run all required field and formatting checks, as well as all On Submit and On Approve rules
AND saving the contract in any Approved or higher state should check that there is not a new "Contract" attachment
AND if there is a new "Contract" attachmen, the user should be given the option to stamp the attached contract
AND the stamp should have the date of the Approval - not the current date

title: As a user I want to see an error if I attempt to create a new UEC for an employee that already has a preliminary one
custom_preconds:

AND an employee already has a preliminary UEC
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects "Employee Contract" from the Create New menu for that employee
custom_expected:
THEN the system will check to see if the employee already has a preliminary UEC.

AND If a preliminary already exists that the user does not have permission to see because it is for another Org, display error #1.
BUT If a preliminary already exists that the user does not have permission to see because it is for a position they do not have permission to open, display error #22. 
AND Either error #1 or error #22 should display - never both.

On Create Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/1.+UEC+-+On+Create+Rules

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Messages

title: As a user I want to be able to delete a Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction
custom_preconds:

custom_steps: WHEN user opens the form in view or edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN user should see a "Delete" button on the form in grey
AND clicking "Delete" should prompt the user to confirm that they wish to delete the form from the system
AND warning should be as follows:
**Title:** Warning
**Body:** Are you sure you want to delete this [form]? ("Form" to be replaced with transaction type)
**Hint:** This is a permanent action that cannot be undone.
**Buttons:** Yes, No
AND if they confirm the deletion, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction and a blue notification should be thrown
BUT if they do not confirm the deletion, then they should be returned to the form and no action should be taken

title: As a BOC user I want approving an Employee's Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction to create an entry in the daily transaction bulletin if applicable

custom_steps: WHEN a  "Placed on Temporarily Inactive List" is approved for a MJ Roster employee
custom_expected:

AND when a  "Placed on Temporarily Inactive List" transaction is reversed, if the "approved" bulletin entry is still on the Pending Bulletin, it should be removed
BUT if it was on a previous Bulletin, then a new entry should be added to the current Pending Daily Transaction Bulletin as " "Placed on Temporarily Inactive List - Reversed" 
AND when a  "Placed on Temporarily Inactive List" is suppressed, if the "reversed" bulletin entry is still on the Pending Bulletin, it should be removed

title: As a Club user I want to receive a notification when my Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction is approved, rejected, or reversed
custom_preconds:

http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=clipboard_-_notifications

custom_expected:

AND initiating Club (or the Club that the employee belongs to) should receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Reversed, unless the transaction is also Suppressed
AND "Description" should be a hyperlink
AND clicking on the description hyperlink of any of these notifications should open the transaction in view mode in the same window/tab

AND clicking on the player's name hyperlink of any of these notifications should open the player's profile in view mode in the same window/tab on the Player History tab

AND If the Org of the initiating user is not BOC or the Current Org of the employee, then display message #1.

title: As a user I want to receive an error if the employee I am creating a Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction for has a pending or approved transaction after the entered assignment date

custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" or "Approve" (All places OnSubmit rules fired)
custom_expected: THEN system will check if the Assignment date is before the latest approved or pending (Pending to Club, Submitted to BOC) transaction date for the employee. If it is, an error will display. Messages #3.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to reverse, reverse and suppress or suppress a Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction
custom_preconds:
See Reverse/Suppress Updates: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/6.+Place+on+Temporarily+Inactive+List
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with approver permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing a Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction (in view or edit mode) in the Approved state
custom_expected:
THEN user should see a "Reverse" button in grey
AND clicking "Reverse" should run all required field and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. (On Submit rules should not be run)
AND successful reverse notification should be displayed. See Messages #16
AND the transaction status should be updated to "Reversed"
AND system should display reversed transaction in player history with "Voided" in front of the transaction description. Example:"Voided: Major/Minor Outright"
AND system should set the employee's Status, Club and Org to their values from prior to the transaction approval
AND users that have permission to suppress the form should see a "Reverse and Suppress" option on Approved transactions and a "Suppress" button on Reversed transactions, both in grey, in either view or edit mode
AND clicking "Reverse and Suppress" should first reverse, and then suppress the transaction
AND clicking "Suppress" should suppress the transaction
AND when a transaction is suppressed it should be hidden from the employee's History, Searches (unless BOC user specifically searches suppressed transactions), and any other place where it is visible on UI
AND clicking "Reverse" or "Reverse and Suppress", should check if the current transaction is the most recent approved transaction
AND if the transaction is not the most recent approved transaction for the employee, then the user should receive an error message
**Message** "Only the player's latest approved transaction can be reversed."
AND user will ONLY have the back option
AND clicking Back should close the modal and return the user to the transaction

title: Place on Temporarily Inactive List Permissions - BOC - Employee Transactions

OR a BOC user is logged in with Employee Place on Temporarily Inactive List Viewer Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with a Temporarily Inactive List transactions
custom_expected:

title: Place on Temporarily Inactive List Permissions - Club - Employee Transactions
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club user is logged in with Employee Place on Temporarily Inactive List Admin Permissions
OR a club user is logged in with Employee Place on Temporarily Inactive List Viewer Permissions
custom_steps: When user attempts to do anything with a Temporarily Inactive Transactions
custom_expected:
THEN user with Viewer permissions can view and print all employee transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs too.

          However, there are exceptions:
                  1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
                  2. They cannot edit or change these transactions (Basic only)
                  3. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
 
AND Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
 
    1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
    2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the employee involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
    3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org

OR User with Admin permissions can view and print all employee transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs too.
 
      However, there are exceptions:
      1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
      2. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field

AND Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
 
      1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
      2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the employee involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
      3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
 
BUT Can NOT create, delete, submit, edit, or attach files to any BOC only employee transactions for employees.

custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" or "Approve"
custom_expected:
THEN system should check if the transaction being approved has a transaction date on or after other pending transactions for the player
AND if yes - an error (Messages #19) Should display stating: "This transaction cannot be approved while a previously submitted transaction is pending."
AND only "Back" button should be available
AND clicking "Back" should return the user to the point of entry

title: As a Club user I want to receive a notification when my Place on Deceased List transaction is approved, rejected or reversed
custom_preconds:
Clipboard Rules (#2, #3, #4): 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Clipboard
GIVEN a user is logged in as a club admin user
AND a Place on Deceased list tx has been submitted for an Employee from logged in user's org
custom_steps:
WHEN the Deceased List tx is Approved, Rejected, or Reversed
AND user is currently viewing the clipboard for their org
custom_expected:
THEN initiating Club (or the Club that the employee belongs to) should receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Approved
AND initiating Club (or the Club that the employee belongs to) should receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Reversed
BUT if the transaction is also Suppressed, club should NOT receive a notification 
AND initiating Club (or the Club that the employee belongs to) should receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Rejected
AND "Description" should be a hyperlink
AND clicking on the description hyperlink of any of these notifications should open the transaction in view mode in the same window/tab
AND Employee's name should be a hyperlink
AND clicking on the employee's name hyperlink of any of these notifications should open the employee's profile in view mode in the same window/tab on the History tab

title: As a user I want to receive an error if the person I'm attempting to create a Deceased List transaction for is not a current employee

Business Rule #8.01, 8.05: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/7.+Place+on+Deceased+List

https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with edit/create permissions for Deceased List tx
AND user is viewing the profile that is NOT a current Employee with an "Active" or "Active (Not Under Contract)" status
custom_steps: WHEN user selects "Place on Deceased List" from the Employee Transaction Create New menu
custom_expected:
THEN system should check that the person is a current Employee with an "Active" or "Active (Not Under Contract)" status
AND if not, system should display Error #12: "This person is not an Active Employee."
AND only a "Back" button should be available
AND clicking "Back" should return user to the point of entry

title: As a user I want to edit an existing Place on Deceased List transaction
custom_preconds:
Data Discovery: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Deceased+List
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with edit permissions for Deceased List tx
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a Place on Deceased List tx in view mode
custom_expected:
THEN an Edit button should be available anytime the form is in view mode if the viewing user has edit permissions for the form in its current state
AND clicking  Edit should reload the form in edit mode
AND a Save button should appear in place of the Edit button (no edit button displayed in edit mode)
AND in Preliminary state, the BOC users should be able to edit all portions displayed on the form
BUT club should not be able to edit existing attachments or any other part of transaction
AND BOC should be able to edit all fields in all states except for Approved and Reversed transactions
AND in Approved and Reversed transactions, edit should only give BOC access to attach new files or edit existing attachments. (They should also be able update "Comments" and "BOC Notes" fields)
BUT they should not be able to edit any other part of transaction unless specifically stated in data discovery
AND a Save button should be available anytime the form is in edit mode
AND clicking Save should save the transaction and it's current values and reload the form in View mode
AND transaction status should be set to "Preliminary" if this is the first time the transaction is being saved. Otherwise the transaction status should not change
AND after a successful save the system should display a successful save blue notification
AND whenever the form is in edit mode, the user should see a "Cancel" button on the form in grey
AND clicking "Cancel" should prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made
AND if they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction
BUT if they confirm the cancellation and the form has been previously saved in the system, then the form should be reloaded into view mode, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected
AND if they do not confirm the cancellation then the user should be returned to the form and no action should be taken

title: As a BOC user I want to approve a Place on Deceased List transaction

custom_steps: WHEN the user is viewing Place on Ineligible List transaction (in view or edit mode) in Preliminary

AND Once all rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Approved"

AND Update History: Code = DEAD (not displayed on front end) , Description = Place on Deceased List , From Org/Club and To Org/Club fields to be in black font. 
AND Update employee's to be "Deceased". Do NOT display this roster status. On front end roster status should appear blank. 
AND Status should not appear on profile or in advanced search. 
AND Update logo displayed on employee profile to standard MLB logo to signify they are no longer associated with a team.
AND Do NOT Add transaction to the Daily Transaction Bulletin.

See Approval Updates: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/7.+Place+on+Deceased+List

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Deceased+List

title: Place on Deceased List Permissions - Club - Employee Transactions - Basic
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club user is logged in with basic (viewer) permissions for Place on Deceased List tx
custom_steps: WHEN basic club user attempts to do anything with a Place on Deceased List tx
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to view and print all employee transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs too
BUT user should NOT be able edit or change these transactions
AND user should NOT be able to see "BOC Notes" field
AND user should NOT be able to view any Transactions that are in Suppressed state 
AND user should be able to view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions 
BUT user should NOT be able to see BOC Notes field for any transaction
AND user should NOT be able to see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. (Note that even if the employee involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org)
AND user should NOT be able to see attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
AND user should NOT be able to create, delete, submit, edit, or attach files to any BOC only employee transactions for employees

custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to view and print all employee transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs too
BUT user should NOT be able to view Transactions that are in Suppressed state
AND user should NOT be able to see "BOC Notes" field
AND user should be able to view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions 
BUT user should NOT be able to see BOC Notes field for any transaction
AND user should NOT be able to see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. (Note that even if the employee involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org)
AND user should NOT be able to see attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
AND user should NOT be able to create, delete, submit, edit, or attach files to any BOC only employee transactions for employees.

title: Place on Deceased List Permissions - BOC - Employee Transactions
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with Employee Place on Deceased List Admin Permissions 
OR a BOC user is logged in with Employee Place on Decease List Viewer Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user attempts to do anything with Employee Place on Deceased List
custom_expected:
THEN BOC with Admin permissions can view and Print all employee league transactions [Club and BOC] in all states for Employees.
AND Can view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states.
AND Can create, delete, edit, e-sign and submit all Employee transactions for Employees (or players where applicable). 
AND Can Approve, Reject, Reverse and Suppress all Employee transactions and see associated Flags.
OR BOC with Viewer permissions can view and Print all employee transactions [Club and BOC] in all states for employees but cannot make any changes or e-sign.
AND Can view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states.

title: Place on Deceased List Permissions - Club - Employee Transactions
custom_preconds:
GIVE a club user is logged in with Employee Place on Deceased List Admin Permissions 
OR a club user is logged in with Employee Place on the Decease List Viewer Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN club user attempts to do anything with Place on Deceased List transactions
custom_expected:
THEN club with Viewer permissions can view and print all employee transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs too.

          However, there are exceptions:
                  1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
                  2. They cannot edit or change these transactions (Basic only)
                  3. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
 
AND Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
 
    1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
    2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the employee involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
    3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org

OR club with admin permissions can view and print all employee transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs too.
 
      However, there are exceptions:
      1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
      2. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field

AND Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
 
      1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
      2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the employee involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
      3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
 
BUT Can NOT create, delete, submit, edit, or attach files to any BOC only employee transactions for employees.

title: As a BOC user I want approving an Employee's Place on Suspended List transaction to create an entry in the daily transaction bulletin if applicable
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user logs in with employee transaction permission
custom_steps: WHEN user approves Place on Suspended List transaction for a MJ Roster employee
custom_expected:

If it was on a previous Bulletin, then a new entry should be added to the current Pending Daily Transaction Bulletin as "Place on Suspended List - Reversed" 
OR When a Place on Suspended List is suppressed, if the "reversed" bulletin entry is still on the Pending Bulletin, it should be removed.
